entry.def: If a country or armed force demobilizes its troops, or if its troops demobilize, its troops are released from service and allowed to go home.

example.ex: Both sides have agreed to demobilize 70% of their armies...
example.tran: 双方都同意各自遣散70%的军队。

example.ex: It is unlikely that the rebels will agree to demobilise.
example.tran: 叛军不太可能会同意解散武装。

entry.def: If someone has been demobilized, they have completed their service in the armed forces of their country.

example.ex: I spent one year in the service and did not come back to the United States until after I was demobilized.
example.tran: 我在部队里呆了一年，直到复员以后才回到美国。

means.word_mean: 1. act of changing from a war basis to a peace basis including disbanding or discharging troops;
